0000r: DMA channel 0 address byte 0, then byte 1.
0000w: DMA channel 0 address byte 0, then byte 1.
0001r: DMA channel 0 word count byte 0, then byte 1.
0001w: DMA channel 0 word count byte 0, then byte 1.
0002r: DMA channel 1 address byte 0, then byte 1.
0002w: DMA channel 1 address byte 0, then byte 1.
0003r: DMA channel 1 word count byte 0, then byte 1.
0003w: DMA channel 1 word count byte 0, then byte 1.
0004r: DMA channel 2 address byte 0, then byte 1.
0004w: DMA channel 2 address byte 0, then byte 1.
0005r: DMA channel 2 word count byte 0, then byte 1.
0005w: DMA channel 2 word count byte 0, then byte 1.
0006r: DMA channel 3 address byte 0, then byte 1.
0006w: DMA channel 3 address byte 0, then byte 1.
0007r: DMA channel 3 word count byte 0, then byte 1.
0007w: DMA channel 3 word count byte 0, then byte 1.
0040r: PIT counter 0, counter divisor (XT, AT, PS/2).
0040w: PIT counter 0, counter divisor (XT, AT, PS/2).
0041r: PIT counter 1, RAM refresh counter (XT, AT).
0041w: PIT counter 1, RAM refresh counter (XT, AT).
0042r: PIT counter 2, cassette & speaker (XT, AT, PS/2).
0042w: PIT counter 2, cassette & speaker (XT, AT, PS/2).
0043r: PIT mode port, control word register for counters 0-2.
0043w: PIT mode port, control word register for counters 0-2.
0044r: PIT counter 3 (PS/2, EISA), used as fail-safe timer. Generates an NMI on time out. For user generated NMI see at 0462.
0044w: PIT counter 3 (PS/2, EISA), used as fail-safe timer. Generates an NMI on time out. For user generated NMI see at 0462.
0047w: PIT control word register counter 3 (PS/2, EISA).
0060r: KeyBoard or KB controller data output buffer (via PPI on XT).
0063r: PPI (XT only) command mode register (read dipswitches).
0063w: PPI (XT only) command mode register (read dipswitches).
0065r: A20 gate control (set = A20 enabled, clear = disabled).
0065w: A20 gate control (set = A20 enabled, clear = disabled).
0070w: CMOS RAM index register port (ISA, EISA).
00C0r: DMA channel 4 memory address bytes 1 and 0 (low) (ISA, EISA).
00C0w: DMA channel 4 memory address bytes 1 and 0 (low) (ISA, EISA).
00C2r: DMA channel 4 transfer count bytes 1 and 0 (low) (ISA, EISA).
00C2w: DMA channel 4 transfer count bytes 1 and 0 (low) (ISA, EISA).
00C4r: DMA channel 5 memory address bytes 1 and 0 (low) (ISA, EISA).
00C4w: DMA channel 5 memory address bytes 1 and 0 (low) (ISA, EISA).
00C6r: DMA channel 5 transfer count bytes 1 and 0 (low) (ISA, EISA).
00C6w: DMA channel 5 transfer count bytes 1 and 0 (low) (ISA, EISA).
00C8r: DMA channel 6 memory address bytes 1 and 0 (low) (ISA, EISA).
00C8w: DMA channel 6 memory address bytes 1 and 0 (low) (ISA, EISA).
00CAr: DMA channel 6 transfer count bytes 1 and 0 (low) (ISA, EISA).
00CAw: DMA channel 6 transfer count bytes 1 and 0 (low) (ISA, EISA).
00CCr: DMA channel 7 memory address byte 0 (low), then 1 (ISA, EISA).
00CCw: DMA channel 7 memory address byte 0 (low), then 1 (ISA, EISA).
00CEr: DMA channel 7 transfer count byte 0 (low), then 1 (ISA, EISA).
00CEw: DMA channel 7 transfer count byte 0 (low), then 1 (ISA, EISA).
00D2w: DMA channel 4-7 write request register (ISA, EISA).
00D4w: DMA channel 4-7 write single mask register (ISA, EISA).
00D8w: DMA channel 4-7 clear byte pointer flip-flop (ISA, EISA).
00DAr: DMA channel 4-7 read temporary register (ISA, EISA).
00DCw: DMA channel 4-7 clear mask register (ISA, EISA).
00DEw: DMA channel 4-7 write mask register (ISA, EISA).
0210w: Expansion unit, latch expansion bus data.
0210r: Expansion unit, verify expansion bus data.
0211w: Expansion unit, clear wait, test latch.
0211r: Expansion unit, High byte data address.
0212r: Expansion unit, Low byte data address.
0214w: Expansion unit, latch data (receiver card port).
0214r: Expansion unit, read data (receiver card port).
0215r: Expansion unit, High byte of address, then Low byte (receiver card port).
0321r: XT HDC 1 read controller hardware status.
0322r: XT HDC 1 read DIPswitch setting on XT controller card.
0323w: XT HDC 1 write pattern to DMA and INT mask register.
0343r: XT RTC minutes 0-59 / XT RTC hours 0-23.
0343w: XT RTC minutes 0-59 / XT RTC hours 0-23.
0370r: 2nd diskette Extra High Density controller board jumpers (AT)
0371r: 2nd diskette controller status B (PS/2, PS/2 model 30)
0377w: 2nd diskette select register for diskette data transfer rate
0388r: Sound Blaster Both Speakers -- Status / Address port
0388w: Sound Blaster Both Speakers -- Status / Address port
03B9w: Reserved for color select register on color adapter
03BAr: CRT status register EGA/VGA: input status 1 register
03BBw: Reserved for light pen strobe reset
03C3r: VGA video subsystem enable (see also port 46E8h)
03C3w: VGA video subsystem enable (see also port 46E8h)
03DAr: CGA status register EGAVGA: input status 1 register
